Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(2) Summary

APIs are the digital glue for how companies operate and collaborate today. This marks a fundamental shift from the original idea of APIs as technical interconnections to one of APIs as the business building blocks of digital transformation. What does this shift mean for our API practices? First and foremost, this means that thinking about an API's business value must be a fundamental part of API inception and design. But it also means that we have to think of APIs as products, meaning that good APIs should be reusable so that they become building blocks with a bigger potential. These API products need to be discoverable because APIs only create value when they are being used. This means that portals, catalogs, and marketplaces should become part of the standard API toolbox so that APIs can be easily created, published, found, tried out, and used. This end-to-end view of APIs is what we mean when we talk about a good API: It's an API that is created with a purpose and within an environment that helps making the most out of this purpose.



Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

Tunnel Style Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(6) One Tunnel to Call them All



Tunnel Style Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(7) Distributed Programming

  • Distribution and Decentralization are two distinct patterns
  • Rooted in Remote Procedure Call (RPC) approaches of the 1980s
  • Functions are the main abstraction calls are tunneled to the server
  • A good fit for developers looking to write a distributed program

Resource Style Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(9) Listing All Resources



Resource Style Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(10) Identifiers for Resources

  • Providing globally identified resources that support interactions
  • Resources ideally are defined through a user-centric design process
  • API Stories help explaining how to walk across resources

Hypermedia Style Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(12) Linking All Resources



Hypermedia Style Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(13) Hypermedia APIs

  • Resources contain hypermedia controls for next steps
  • Workflows are designed into the API
  • Hypermedia API landscapes fell like one huge API
  • Developers can have a hard time letting go of controlling the flow

Query Style Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(15) Querying into Server-Side Models



Query Style Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(16) Querying Structured Data

  • Good for APIs with a vast interconnected data space
  • APIs are based on a generic data model and matching query language
  • Challenging learning curve for complex data models
  • Change management and security are non-trivial


Event-Based Style

Outline (Event-Based Style)

Event-Based Style Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(18) Event Publish/Subscribe



Event-Based Style Erik Wilde (@dret): What is a Good API?

(19) Reversing Control

  • Good fit when actions originate on the server
  • Requires an event fabric to deliver events to consumers
  • Big range of models from per API to Event Service Bus (ESB)
  • Used more for private than for partner/public APIs
